definition[0]: a condition that you ask for before you will agree to something
example[0]: The money was given to the museum with the proviso that it should be spent on operating costs.
definition[1]: a part of a contract that covers a particular subject
example[1]: Landlords frequently include a proviso stating that nothing contained in the lease shall prevent them from carrying out work on their property.
definition[2]: something that must happen before you will agree to something
example[2]: The only proviso is that you should let the office manager know well in advance if you decide to take a day off.
example[3]: Some companies are happy to invest in community projects, with the proviso that the government does not neglect its own duty.
